# [14.1 Meteors](https://openstax.org/books/astronomy-2e/pages/14-1-meteors)

# What is a Meteor

- Tiny particles entering Earth's atmosphere and burning up.
- Speeds between tens to hundreds of km/s (relative to Earth).
- Burn up between 80 and 130 km altitude. 
- Most have a mass less than 1 gram.

# How can we see shooting stars?

Most meteors are tiny objects, so why are they visible?


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="45%"}
::: {.callout-note icon=false}
## Energy of an Artillery Shell
- Mass = 106 kg (Paris Gun)
- Speed = 1.6 km/s

---------------------

$$K=\tfrac{1}{2}mv^2$$

---------------------

- Energy = $1.4\times10^{8}$ J <br> 
::: 
:::
::: {.column width="45%"}
::: {.callout-note icon=false}
## Energy of a Meteor
- Mass = 0.5 g
- Speed = 230 km/s

---------------------

$$K=\tfrac{1}{2}mv^2$$

---------------------

- Energy = $1.3\times10^8$ J

::: 
:::

::::

About the same amount of energy in one gallon of gasoline.
